newsitem.title: USA: Fed refrains from open market operations.
newsitem.headline: Fed refrains from open market operations.

text.p: The Federal Reserve refrained from open market operations on Wednesday, dealers said.

Analysts had expected the Fed to take no action, saying that the Fed's temporary addition of reserves to the banking system on Monday through three-day-system repurchase agreements had adequately addressed the current reserve need.
As evidence for this, they cited the Federal funds rate which was trading at 5-3/16 percent during the morning and at the Fed's habitual time for open market operations.
The Fed's target for the funds rate is 5-1/4 percent.
